How to Install gss-doc on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • gss-doc

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install gss-doc on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing gss-doc on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall gss-doc in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install gss-doc, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install gss-doc Using apt

To install gss-doc in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install gss-doc using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install gss-doc

The installation of gss-doc might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install gss-doc Using apt-get

To install gss-doc using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install gss-doc.

sudo apt-get -y install gss-doc

Install gss-doc Using Synaptic

To install gss-doc using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install gss-doc on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for gss-doc. This will display the gss-doc package in the package window, now to install gss-doc, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the gss-doc package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of gss-doc.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install gss-doc Using aptitude

To install gss-doc on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of gss-doc.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install gss-doc using the command aptitude install gss-doc.

sudo aptitude -y install gss-doc

How to Upgrade gss-doc on debian

If you want to upgrade the gss-doc package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade gss-doc using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade gss-doc to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade gss-doc.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade gss-doc sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade gss-doc

Upgrade gss-doc using Aptitude

To upgrade gss-doc using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade gss-doc.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade gss-doc

Upgrade gss-doc using Synaptic

To upgrade gss-doc using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for gss-doc, now right-click gss-doc, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade gss-doc just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall gss-doc on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall gss-doc from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just gss-doc, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove gss-doc

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of gss-doc

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of gss-doc you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge gss-doc

Remove gss-doc using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall gss-doc using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for gss-doc, right-click the gss-doc package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall gss-doc click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install gss-doc on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade gss-doc using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of gss-doc then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
